  <title>
   Leash - Access Linux Shell from a Browser
  </title>
  <link href="http://leash.jcubic.pl" rel="canonical"/>
  <meta content="Leash give you shell access without ssh, telnet or root access (you don't need to install anything on the server). You can use it on shared hosting." name="Description"/>

 <body>
  <section>
   <header>
    <h2>
     <pre>
      __   _______   ______ __
    / /  / __/ _ | / __/ // /
  / /__/ _// __ |_\ \/ _  /
/____/___/_/ |_/___/_//_/
     </pre>
    </h2>
    <h1>
     <span>
      Leash -
     </span>
     Browser Shell
    </h1>
   </header>
   <ul>
    <li>
     Do you use hosting without root?
    </li>
    <li>
     You don't have ssh but you want shell access?
    </li>
    <li>
     Leash is for you
    </li>
   </ul>
   <p>
    Leash use
    <a href="http://terminal.jcubic.pl" title="jQuery Terminal Emulator">
     jQuery Terminal
    </a>
    to create access to bash
    <i>
     Unix/Linux
    </i>
    shell from the browser. (With few features written in JavaScript). It's not full terminal like
    <a href="http://freecode.com/projects/shellinabox">
     shell in a box
    </a>
    , AjaxTerm or
    <a href="http://g33kinfo.com/info/archives/5992">
     Buterfly
    </a>
    but you don't need to install anything on the server (so you don't need root access) just upload and run.
   </p>
   <h3>
    Features
   </h3>
   <ul>
    <li>
     access to the sell
    </li>
    <li>
     less command, that's also used by man command
    </li>
    <!-- &lt;li&gt;You can execute commands using JSON array as url hash it also work with login (like #["user", "password", "jargon hacker", "exit"])&lt;/li&gt;-->
    <li>
     mysql access with tab completion
    </li>
    <li>
     python interpreter
    </li>
    <li>
     Javascript interpreter
    </li>
    <li>
     jargon command that display entries from jargon file
    </li>
   </ul>
   <h3>
    Demo
   </h3>
   <iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="360" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/giwslioIe_g" width="480">
   </iframe>
   <h3>
    Install
   </h3>
   <p>
    Just upload all the files on the server, run and follow the instruction (you must be sure that cgi-bin/python.py and cgi-bin/cmd.py have execute permissions - the second only if you will use this shell)
   </p>
   <h3>
    Download
   </h3>
   <!-- &lt;p&gt;Lasted package&lt;/p&gt; -->
   <p>
    The source code is available on
    <a href="http://github.com/jcubic/leash/">
     github
    </a>
   </p>
   <h3>
    License
   </h3>
   <p>
    Licensed with
    <a href="http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html">
     GNU GPL 3 or any later
    </a>
   </p>
